meanings.definition: A wartlike growth on the skin or mucous membrane, typically in the genital area, caused by a virus.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with a condyloma on their genital area.
meanings.sent2: She was worried about the condyloma on her skin and sought medical advice.
meanings.sent3: The condyloma on his hand made him look like he had grown a tiny tree.
meanings.sent4: The condyloma was a stubborn invader, clinging to her skin like a determined weed.
meanings.sent5: The condyloma, with its rough texture, felt like a small pebble embedded in her skin.

meanings.sent1: The clinic reported an increase in cases of condyloma in the community.
meanings.sent2: Her fear of condyloma spread among her friends after hearing about it on the news.
meanings.sent3: The party theme unintentionally turned into a condyloma costume contest.
meanings.sent4: The condyloma in the room was so obvious, it felt like an elephant no one mentioned.
meanings.sent5: The condyloma seemed to cast a shadow over the otherwise cheerful gathering.
